solution_line_template: Janice typed {sentences_per_minute} * {minutes_before_break} = <<{sentences_per_minute}*{minutes_before_break}={sentences_before_break}>>{sentences_before_break} sentences before her break.
She typed {sentences_per_minute} * {minutes_after_break} = <<{sentences_per_minute}*{minutes_after_break}={sentences_after_break}>>{sentences_after_break} sentences after her break.
She typed {sentences_per_minute} * {minutes_after_meeting} = <<{sentences_per_minute}*{minutes_after_meeting}={sentences_after_meeting}>>{sentences_after_meeting} sentences after her meeting.

Therefore, she typed {sentences_before_break} + {sentences_after_break} + {sentences_after_meeting} = <<{sentences_before_break}+{sentences_after_break}+{sentences_after_meeting}={total_sentences_typed}>>{total_sentences_typed} sentences today in all.

She had to erase {sentences_erased} sentences, so she had {total_sentences_typed} - {sentences_erased} = <<{total_sentences_typed}-{sentences_erased}={sentences_typed_left}>>{sentences_typed_left} sentences that she typed today left.

Thus, she had X = {sentences_at_end} - {sentences_typed_left} = <<{sentences_at_end}-{sentences_typed_left}={sentences_started_with}>>{sentences_started_with} sentences typed on the paper to start with today.
